intro: Corunastylis albiglans, commonly known as the white-flowered star sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its most distinctive characteristic is its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils.
